main event: Two round, 40 ft in diameter objects were observed in San Pedro, California on 3-11-1957. They were initially thought to be JATO or Navy objects before disappearing from view.
interesting points: The objects were 40 ft in diameter and colored white.
A control center assistant reported that the object of unusual size and shape, colored silver, disappeared suddenly and stopped suddenly before disappearing from view.
The object was tracked on radar and observed visually, making it an unusual and unexplained sighting.
Weather conditions indicated clear visibility, ruling out visual effects.
The report was submitted by an assistant chief control center from the Los Angeles Air Defense Command, adding credibility to the observation.
sighted object: two round, 40 ft in diameter objects
